result.execSummary:
The defendant Cristobal O Guerrero-Kresovich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Sentence credit of 5 days is granted. TIME SERVED

-Court order another 36 days in credit. Waives standard court costs. 
-DNA Surcharge to be paid within 60 days. Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cristobal O Guerrero-Kresovich

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Herbers advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

11:29 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Cristobal O Guerrero-Kresovich in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Cristobal O Guerrero-Kresovich. 

The Court conducts a plea colloquy with the Defendant.
The Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1.
The Court finds the Defendant guilty of Count 1.
Counts 2& 3 are dismissed and read into Count 1.

The State gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defense gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defendant presents a statement.


The defendant was sentenced to the following:

JAIL:  5 days (Credit - 5 days). TIME SERVED;

COSTS: WAIVE.  
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200;
Defendant to provide DNA sample, within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

The Court orders another 36 days in credit and waives court costs. 

Payment of Costs/Surcharges/Fine:  To be paid in 60 days. Civil judgment entered as penalty for non payment.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Pre-trial conference on September 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

09:03 AM Defendant Cristobal O Guerrero-Kresovich in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
